secText: Studying waves and simple harmonic motion together makes sense when one considers the motion of the particles of the medium that carries the wave.

When we track the location of an individual particle in the wave using the red circle, we see it moves in simple harmonic motion.  The example shows a transverse wave, but the same holds true for longitudinal waves.
As should be expected with SHM, the particle moves fastest at the midpoint of its motion, and slowest at the extremes.
